main event: A silver unidentified aerial object was observed on radar maintaining a 55,000 foot altitude and performing fast evasive maneuvers, and then descended to 20,000 feet and passed over Hill Air Force Base, Utah.
interesting points: The object was observed on radar maintaining a high altitude of 55,000 feet and then descended to 20,000 feet before passing over the air force base.
The object was described as silver in color and made fast evasive maneuvers, with a ground speed estimated to be between 200 to 500 knots.
Despite attempts, no radar contact or communication was established with the object, which disappeared from the radar screen shortly after being sighted.
This sighting was documented in a declassified Project Blue Book document, indicating its significance in the study of unidentified aerial objects by the U.S. Air Force.

The report was transmitted as an incoming classified message from the Commander of the 10th Collective Security Investigation Division at Hill Air Force Base to the Office of Special Investigations (OSI) at the U.S. Air Force in Washington D.C.
